skill.name: baoyu-post-to-x
skill.description: Post content and articles to X (Twitter). Supports regular posts with images and X Articles (long-form Markdown). Uses real Chrome with CDP to bypass anti-automation.
skill.summary: Post text, images, and long-form articles to X (Twitter) using real Chrome browser automation

security_audit.summary: Legitimate browser automation skill for posting to X. All static findings are false positives - the code uses standard browser automation patterns (Chrome DevTools Protocol) similar to Puppeteer/Playwright. No malicious intent, data exfil, or surveillance behavior detected.

static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Terms 'keystroke', 'paste', 'clipboard' refer to legitimate OS clipboard APIs (osascript, System Events, PowerShell SendKeys). Used only to paste images into Chrome browser. No keylogging, credential harvesting, or input capture exists.
Documentation describing paste keystroke automation. Standard clipboard API documentation, not malicious keylogging.
Comment references paste operation for images. Uses paste-from-clipboard.ts helper, not keystroke capture.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [CRITICAL] obfuscation: DANGEROUS COMBINATION - Code execution + Network + Credential access
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Pattern triggered by child_process, WebSocket, and Chrome profile access. This is standard browser automation architecture (same as Puppeteer/Playwright). No obfuscation or evasion - all operations are documented and transparent.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] blocker: Weak cryptographic algorithm (MD5) at scripts/md-to-html.ts:96
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: MD5 used only to generate short cache filenames for remote images. Not used for security/cryptographic purposes. Standard hashing for filename determinism.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] external_commands: Node.js child_process module at scripts/x-article.ts:1, x-browser.ts:1, copy-to-clipboard.ts:1, paste-from-clipboard.ts:1
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Standard imports for legitimate browser automation. All spawn calls use hardcoded arguments, no command injection vectors.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] external_commands: Process spawn at scripts/x-browser.ts:221, x-article.ts:204
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Chrome browser launch with controlled arguments. Chrome path from env var or hardcoded candidates. Arguments are predefined strings, not user input.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] external_commands: PowerShell invocation at scripts/copy-to-clipboard.ts:239,249, paste-from-clipboard.ts:130
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: PowerShell used only for Windows clipboard operations with hardcoded scripts. No arbitrary command execution.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] network: Net server creation (opens port) at scripts/x-browser.ts:37, x-article.ts:19
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Chrome debugging port allocation for CDP connection. Port is ephemeral (getFreePort), opened briefly, closed after use. Standard browser automation.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [HIGH] sensitive: Environment file access at scripts/x-browser.ts:56,97, x-article.ts:34,62
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Environment access limited to X_BROWSER_CHROME_PATH (optional Chrome override) and XDG_DATA_HOME (profile directory). No credential storage or sensitive data access.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] external_commands: Ruby/shell backtick execution at SKILL.md:12-94, references/articles.md, references/regular-posts.md
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Documentation examples showing npx bun script execution. Safe development workflow pattern, not code execution vulnerabilities.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] network: WebSocket connection at scripts/x-browser.ts:165, x-article.ts:116
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: WebSocket used for Chrome DevTools Protocol communication. Standard browser automation pattern. Connects only to local Chrome debug port.
Atomics.wait used for synchronous sleep. Required for spawnSync coordination. Not related to Spectre attacks - no cross-origin data access.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] filesystem: Temp directory access at scripts/md-to-html.ts:263, copy-to-clipboard.ts:120, x-article.ts:193
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Standard temp directory usage for image caching and clipboard operations. os.tmpdir() is safe, files cleaned up after use.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [MEDIUM] filesystem: File stream creation at scripts/md-to-html.ts:49, copy-to-clipboard.ts:115
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: FileWriteStream for downloading remote images. Uses standard Node.js fs API for legitimate content publishing.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [LOW] env_access: Environment variable access at scripts/x-browser.ts:56,97, x-article.ts:34,62
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Environment access for Chrome path configuration and profile directory. Standard practice for tool configuration - not accessing secrets.

static_findings_evaluation.finding: [LOW] network: Hardcoded URL at scripts/x-browser.ts:9, x-article.ts:11
static_findings_evaluation.reasoning: Hardcoded URLs are legitimate X/Twitter endpoints. Expected targets for a social media posting skill.

content.value_statement: Automate posting text, images, and long-form articles to X (Twitter). Uses real Chrome browser to bypass anti-automation detection and support full content creation workflows.
actual_capabilities: Post regular tweets with text and up to 4 images
Publish long-form X Articles from Markdown files
Convert Markdown to HTML with image placeholders
Copy images and HTML to system clipboard
Send real paste keystrokes (Cmd+V/Ctrl+V) to bypass detection
Use persistent Chrome profile for saved login sessions
limitations: Requires Google Chrome or Chromium installed
X Premium subscription required for X Articles
First run requires manual login in browser
Accessibility permissions needed for paste automation (macOS)
Rate limiting may occur if posting too frequently

best_practices: Always preview before using --submit to verify content renders correctly
Set X_BROWSER_CHROME_PATH env var if Chrome is in a non-standard location
Keep Chrome window visible during image paste operations for best results
anti_patterns: Do not run without previewing first - always verify content before publishing
Do not ignore rate limiting warnings from X
Do not attempt to post copyrighted or harmful content

faq.question: What permissions does this skill need?
faq.answer: Chrome must be installed. On macOS, grant Accessibility permission to Terminal for paste automation.

faq.question: How does login work?
faq.answer: First run opens Chrome - log in manually. Cookies are saved to profile directory for future runs.

faq.question: Can I post without Chrome installed?
faq.answer: No. This skill uses real Chrome via CDP to bypass anti-automation detection.

faq.question: What image formats are supported?
faq.answer: PNG, JPEG, GIF, and WebP. Maximum 4 images per regular post.

faq.question: How do I preview without posting?
faq.answer: Omit the --submit flag. The skill will open Chrome for preview and keep it open briefly.

faq.question: Can I use a custom Chrome profile?
faq.answer: Yes. Use --profile /path/to/profile to specify a custom Chrome user data directory.
